sections.title: Introduction (Wide Shot)
sections.content: Hey everyone, I’m Jihad Al Sayed, and today we’re digging into the matrix equation Ax = b. This is where linear algebra gets clean, structured, and powerful — especially for computer science and machine learning.

sections.title: What Is Ax = b?
sections.content: Ax = b is a compact way to represent a system of linear equations. A is the matrix of coefficients, x is the variable vector, and b is the result vector.

sections.title: Example: Translating a System to Ax = b
Solving Ax = b with Row Reduction
Why Ax = b Is Powerful
sections.content: This form allows algorithms to solve massive systems efficiently. It's the backbone of numerical methods, simulations, optimizations, and neural networks.

sections.title: Recap
sections.content: We broke down Ax = b as a matrix equation, rewrote a system in that form, solved it with row operations, and visualized it graphically. This is how math scales to real-world problems.
